subject: Redfish : Implement LocationIndicatorActive for PCIeSlots
commitMessage:
Redfish : Implement LocationIndicatorActive for PCIeSlots

Implement LocationIndicatorActive for PCIeSlot schema, We can use locationindicatoractive to set or get the status of the location led of each pcie slot.

https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/PCIeSlots.v1_4_1.json

We need to set the LocationIndicatorActive of all the slots in the dopatch command, even if we only want to modify one of them.(ex: see the third test result)

Tested: Validator passes.
1、Get LocationIndicatorActive
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots",
  "@odata.type": "#PCIeSlots.v1_4_1.PCIeSlots",
  "Id": "PCIeSlots",
  "Name": "PCIe Slot Information",
  "Slots": [
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": false,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    },
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": false,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    }
  ]
}

We will see the slots identify leds is false too.
busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test1slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b false

busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test2slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b false

2、Set LocationIndicatorActive to true
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X PATCH -d '{"Slots":[{"LocationIndicatorActive":true},{"LocationIndicatorActive":true}]}' https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots

Then we will see the slot location LED lit up, and the LocationIndicatorActive value becomes true:
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots",
  "@odata.type": "#PCIeSlots.v1_4_1.PCIeSlots",
  "Id": "PCIeSlots",
  "Name": "PCIe Slot Information",
  "Slots": [
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": true,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    },
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": true,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    }
  ]
}

We will see the slots identify leds is true too.
busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test1slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b true

busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test2slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b true

3、We need to set the LocationIndicatorActive of all the slots in the dopatch command, even if we only want to modify one of them. And accept an empty object {} to leave an element unchanged.
for example:
Now LocationIndicatorActive of both slots is false:
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots",
  "@odata.type": "#PCIeSlots.v1_4_1.PCIeSlots",
  "Id": "PCIeSlots",
  "Name": "PCIe Slot Information",
  "Slots": [
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": false,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    },
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": false,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    }
  ]
}

We want to set LocationIndicatorActive of the second slot to true. We can send this command:
curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X PATCH -d '{"Slots":[{},{"LocationIndicatorActive":true}]}' https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots

curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots",
  "@odata.type": "#PCIeSlots.v1_4_1.PCIeSlots",
  "Id": "PCIeSlots",
  "Name": "PCIe Slot Information",
  "Slots": [
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": false,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    },
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": true,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    }
  ]
}

busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test1slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b false

busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test2slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b true

4、 Use set-property to change the value
busctl set-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test1slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted b true

busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test1slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b true

busctl get-property xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager /xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/test2slot_identify xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group Asserted
b false

curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/chassis/PCIeSlots",
  "@odata.type": "#PCIeSlots.v1_4_1.PCIeSlots",
  "Id": "PCIeSlots",
  "Name": "PCIe Slot Information",
  "Slots": [
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": true,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    },
    {
      "HotPluggable": false,
      "Lanes": 16,
      "LocationIndicatorActive": false,
      "PCIeType": "Gen1",
      "SlotType": "FullLength"
    }
  ]
}

Signed-off-by: Chicago Duan <duanzhijia01@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I64c0ed90b37a17d3b7d834a0844228406e82575f

please use mapper get service
Done

What are these mapped ?.. I mean, D-Bus objects .. 

Also, please capture the busctl get-property along with this
Done

What are these mapped to ?.. Please have tests where `busctl set-property` is used and capture both busctl and this redfish here.

Also please have different tests for slot 0 and 1
Done

This is the service name right ?

dbus-send --system --print-reply --dest=xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper /xyz/openbmc_project/object_mapper xyz.openbmc_project.ObjectMapper.GetObject  string:"/xyz/openbmc_project/led/groups/fan1_identify"  array:string:"xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group"
method return time=1619438623.614174 sender=:1.24 -> destination=:1.231 serial=3736 reply_serial=2
   array [

      dict entry(
         string "xyz.openbmc_project.LED.GroupManager"
         array [
            string "org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable"
            string "org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer"
            string "org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties"
            string "xyz.openbmc_project.Led.Group"
         ]
      )
   ]
Yes.
It's not Object
Done
Is this acceptable vs some static data member ?

I don't think we can use static data member. 
We need to change its value in lambda and continue to use it outside of lambda.
we need Associations.Definitions as in CPU / DIMM ?
Yes, Check associations on line 497.
I have seen rest all bmcweb codes leave a line spacing between these
Done
I would prefer a more meaningful variable name than 'i' as it's hard to follow variables with 'I/j/k'
Done

Can we remove this?
Because I do not think we need to return 500 error if there are no associations
Done
In case there is no entry in association file. I think we don't need to log internalError.
oh.. We should not be logging any error if there is no association. Not having association is perfectly fine.

Here we only determine whether endpoints is a null pointer. 
It won't record any errors if there is no association.
Is this expected to be exactly of Size 1?
Are you thinking of 1:many associations ?. I would think it would always be 1 since it's LED group association and LED Group D-Bus object would just be 1
nit: Can we use reference here?
Done
Do we need to execute this loop only once?
Yes, only once.

It seems that the global variable is not needed.You only use this variable in two methods, and the first method calls the second method. After the methods are executed, this variable does not need to keep alive, so is it better to use function parameters?
This global variable is used to record the total number of pcieslot. It will be +1 in asynchronous calls (line 377), so we need to use a global variable

Does 

'{"Slots":[{}, {}, {"LocationIndicatorActive":true}]}' also work?

No, I tried to drill down this further but , eventually goes and hit this window here https://github.com/ibm-openbmc/bmcweb/blob/1020/redfish-core/include/utils/json_utils.hpp#L375 . So, there is no easy way right now to make this work
Please use the new privilege framework
Hi @Abhishek Patel, Why did you upload patch set 17? The code you uploaded will cause CI failed and remove some new features in this commit.
